comment.body:
>Adguard does not block any kind of ad when u freshly start chrome.
And it only not blocks ads for the tab that was open at launch.
Other tabs with ads will get blocked and if i refresh the tab that was open at launch, then the ads will get blocked too.

It's rather not a filters issue, probably related to - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardBrowserExtension/issues/2372

comment.body:
On iOS, the advertisement cannot be blocked be any DNS filtering-based adblocker (including AdGuard and Unicorn Pro adblocker).

<details><summary>한국어 - Korean</summary>

iOS에서 (AdGuard와 유니콘 Pro 광고 차단기를 포함해) 어떤 DNS 필터링 기반 애드블록도 그 광고를 차단할 수 없습니다.

</details> 

Reference: https://github.com/List-KR/List-KR/issues/713#issuecomment-1574794836

comment.body: I know that adblocking works differently between safari and apps, and that the AdGuard DNS service is what blocks ads on apps. I don’t know why adblocking on apps would suddenly stop working for no reason after working fine for several years now. Should I just wait then? And why did you immediately close this ticket, isn’t there anything else I could do to try and fix the problem?

comment.body:
The issue was closed for the reason I said above as `cannot reproduce`.

> I don’t know why adblocking on apps would suddenly stop working for no reason after working fine for several years now

Seems that the problem is general and not only related to the app as you also mentioned early.
Btw, could you show the filtering log after launching the app?

List-KR 필터에 의해 해결되었습니다.
패치는 최대 4시간안에 사용하실 수 있습니다.
최대 4시간이 지난 후에 AdGuard 홈에 있는 `업데이트 확인`을 터치해서 다운로드하실 수 있습니다.

</details>

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.rtl.lu/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.rtl.lu%2F) ### Comment > The login popup does not work when AdGuard is enabled. You have to disable AdGuard and to accept the cookies to login. I suppose only the "Gigya"-Cookie has to be accepted so that the login popup works. (see https://www.rtl.lu/login-help at the bottom of the page). ### Screenshots

comment.body:
It's better to use `:has` if possible, because it has a native support in CSS.
For example:
`houjin.info#?#.span4 > div.widget:has(> div.menu-menu-1-container > ul.circle_group)`

comment.body:
The way I see it, the ads in your screenshot look like they are being downloaded from google, but to check this please do next:
1. Open the filtering log (recent activity) and keep it in the background
2. Return to the app and click on the ad
3. After opening the ad, go back to the filtering log and if you see requests from google aka `DoubleClick`, then this is it.
	Note that the requests from `DoubleClick` should be blocked on your side.

Have you used any VPN software other than AdGuard?

comment.body:
Not reproduced it on my end.
Try to clear browser data, update the filters (wait almost one minute there), open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

comment.body:
> `tumblr.com#%#//scriptlet('set-cookie-reload', 'logged_in', '1')`

In uBO dev build, it's

```adb
tumblr.com##+js(set-cookie, logged_in, 1, , reload, 1)
```

pull_request.title: three.com.hk: fix mobile apps download banners
pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [x] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/156451

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

<!-- Please write a comment here -->

2. Screenshots

<details>

<summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

<details>

<summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

### Issue URL (Annoyance) [https://www.tumblr.com/g5mlp/722197667027025920/the-entire-my-little-pony-2024-franchise-overview](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.tumblr.com%2Fg5mlp%2F722197667027025920%2Fthe-entire-my-little-pony-2024-franchise-overview) ### Comment Username: @DandelionSprout > While not logged in, an uncloseable login prompt when scrolling down on not only frontpages, but also very long individual posts nowadays. > > Since the mass exodus from Twitter to Tumblr seems to me personally like it'd warrant fast treatment, I'll let you guys borrow `www.tumblr.com#?##glass-container:has(p + p):has(a[href^="/auth/google?"])` from Dandelion Sprout's Annoyances List into AdGuard Popups Filters with no reservations or conditions of any kind. Alternately you guys can also use whichever entries you guys would write. > > The entry has worked for at least 2 months now, even if there still may be other Tumblr-side annoyances remaining (Most notably that the ••• buttons don't work after scrolling down slightly, which I never found a good fix for). ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adtidy.org/sitereports/3ile3nh8woe884w0k8gog4kw0k4gsg86bgh67exwww.png?nc=1)
